<noinclude>{{month: * '''[[1896]]''' - [[E.V. Gordon]], a later colleague of Tolkien, is born.
* '''[[1938]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] gives an invitational speech at the Lovelace Society, the essay club of [[wikipedia:Worcester College, Oxford
February: Worcester College, Oxford.]] He reads them ''The Legend of Worming Hall'', a story that would become ''[[Farmer Giles of Ham]]''.

<noinclude>{{month: * '''[[2008]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]: [[The Lord of the Rings Online: Shadows of Angmar
February: Shadows of Angmar]]'', "[[The Ashen Wastes]]" is released in Europe.

<noinclude>{{month: In editions prior to the ''[[The Lord of the Rings (50th Anniversary Edition)
hide30=yes: Tale of Years]] mentions two events on this day in {{TA
hide31=yes}}: 3019}}: [[Gandalf]] returning to life, and the [[Mirror of Galadriel]]-sequence. Since it is clear from the narrative that the latter event occurred one day before departure on [[16 February]], this causes a problem in the chronology. [[Wayne G. Hammond
column6: Scull]] decided to fix the Tale of Years so that the [[Mirror of Galadriel]]-sequence happened on [[15 February]]. The return to life of Gandalf was also moved to this date, for reasons unclear.
